did.abstract: Valeriu Marcu (1899-1942) was a Romanian poet, writer, and historian. Eva was his wife. He is known for writing about Vladimir Lenin. The collection contains photocopies of correspondence between Eva Marcu and Heinrich Brning, 1941-1942 and photocopies of articles by Valeriu Marcu, 1941.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Valeriu Marcu was born on March 8, 1899 in Bucharest, Romania. Marcu was a poet, writer, and historian and was a contemporary and acquaintance among Lenin and Leon Trotsky and Arnolt Bronnen. Marcu migrated from Germany to France in 1933 during Hitler's rise, and eventually emigrated to the United States with his wife Eva. Marcu died on July 4, 1942 in New York City..

Eva Marcu was born in Dahlem, Germany in 1908. When the Marcu's emigrated to the United States, Eva Marcu taught at various universities including Columbia and Rutgers. Eva Marcu studied Latin and nationalism. Eva died on May 12, 2004.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains photocopies of correspondence between Eva Marcu and Heinrich Brning, 1941-1942 and photocopies of articles by Valeriu Marcu, 1941.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is unprocessed and is likely disorganized. Individual items may be difficult to find.
